title: [Suggest] About a type of parameter in LossFunction(BCE,BCEWithLogits)
body_html:
• OS: Windows7
  • PyTorch version: 0.3.1
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • Python version: 3.54
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: None
  • GPU models and configuration: None
  • GCC version (if compiling from source): None

In addition, including the following information will also be very helpful for us to diagnose the problem:

  • I recommend changing the type of the parameter(BCELoss, BCEWithLogits)
  • When users use nn.BCELoss(), the type of 'weight' parameter is Variable
    -> example : loss = nn.BCELoss(weight=Variable(weight))
  • When users use nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss(), the type of 'weight' parameter is Tensor
    -> example : loss = nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss(weight=torch.FloatTensor(weight))

I know why this difference happens.
In BCELoss
-> return F.binary_cross_entropy(input, target, weight=self.weight, size_average=self.size_average)

In BCELossWithLogitsLoss
-> return F.binary_cross_entropy_with_logits(input, target, Variable(self.weight), self.size_average)

I know it's not a critical problem, this is just my opinion.
